docs.lead_paragraph: In the Farrelly brothers’ “Hall Pass” two men suffering marital fatigue get a week off from their marriages. Let the ogling commence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The organization Human Rights Watch has been putting itself in harm's way recently, monitoring the upheavals in the Mideast.

I recently read article an article in the New York Times under the headline "When Factories Vanish, So Can Innovators." Since I run a small factory, I read it with interest. Here are a couple of highlights:

headline.main: Why I Think Manufacturing Has a Future

docs.abstract: At my factory, we're now making twice the amount of product per person that we were five years ago.
docs.snippet: At my factory, we're now making twice the amount of product per person that we were five years ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: JF & SON, with its hand-enhanced garments made in India and China, has moved from Kenmare Street in NoLIta to larger, sunnier digs in Greenwich Village. ''We are near the fancy antiques stores on University Place and Union Square's fast-fashion chains,'' said Jesse Finkelstein, an owner. He and his partner, Katie King (above), said they manufacture their items, which include men's clothes, in factories that offer a living wage and health insurance. Spring items include skirts in light fabrics, sleeveless maxi-dresses (like the Swan dress, above, $320) and textures like simple beading and embroidery. JF & Son, 56 University Place (10th Street); (212) 343-3131, jfandson.com.

headline.main: Basking In a Sunny Spot In the Village

docs.lead_paragraph: After three dismal years, the American banking industry regained its footing in 2010, according to a regulatory assessment released on Wednesday. Bank profits rebounded sharply. Loan losses eased. And only 24 lenders were added to the government's list of troubled banks, the smallest increase since the financial crisis erupted in late 2007.

headline.main: Banks Regained Footing in 2010, F.D.I.C. Says, but Another Step Still Remains

docs.abstract: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation says American banking industry, following three dismal years, regained footing in 2010 but still faces challenges as list of 'problem banks' has grown to 884, or one in nine lenders; photo (M)
docs.snippet: After three dismal years, the American banking industry regained its footing in 2010, according to a regulatory assessment released on Wednesday.     Bank profits rebounded sharply. Loan losses eased. And only 24 lenders were added to the...

docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, President Obama directed the Justice Department to stop defending the law that bans federal recognition of same-sex marriages. And while the decision will -- and should -- be celebrated by gay couples across the country, practically speaking, their lives won't change much for some time.

headline.main: What the Gay Marriage News Means for You

docs.abstract: The financial inequities that gay couples face will remain for now, even if they are married.
docs.snippet: The financial inequities that gay couples face will remain for now, even if they are married.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: David, you wrote a very evenhanded column about the situation in Wisconsin that I admired. Unfortunately, when it comes to budgetary issues I have wandered off to the land of the insanely angry.
docs.abstract: Cutting spending is one thing, but do we have to destroy public sector unions to deal with the deficit?
